title: La NASA lanza páginas web en español sobre aeronáutica
summary: Como parte de su empeño por proporcionar más recursos e información a nuevos públicos, la NASA ha lanzado nuevas páginas web con información sobre aeronáutica en español. El objetivo de estas páginas es hacer más accesible el contenido aeronáutico a la comunidad hispanohablante.

title: NASA Launches Aeronautics Spanish-Language Webpages
summary: As part of its effort to provide more resources and information to new audiences, NASA has launched new webpages featuring aeronautics information in Spanish. The webpages aim to make aeronautics content more accessible to the Spanish-language community.

title: Arriving at Titan: How Dragonfly’s Entry, Descent, and Landing will differ from Mars missions
summary: Since the focus on Martian exploration ramped up in the mid-1990s, most of the familiarity with the Entry, Descent, and Landing (EDL) sequence of landers and rovers to the surface of other planets has taken place against the backdrop of Mars.

title: NASA still working on long-term plans for ISS seat barters
summary: As NASA prepares to launch another commercial crew mission with a Russian cosmonaut on board, the agency says it has yet to work out an agreement with Roscosmos on future crew swaps.

title: Hispasat invests in reforestation to drive sustainability expansion strategy
summary: After recently investing in Spain’s largest reforestation project, Madrid-based operator Hispasat hopes to use a satellite SpaceX is launching next month to support other sustainability projects across Latin America.

title: Janus considering alternative missions after losing original ride
summary: A NASA asteroid smallsat mission that lost its original ride to space is considering alternative missions while also accommodating performance issues with its propulsion system.

title: Rocket Report: NASA validates new engine design; Chinese firm tests mini Starship
summary: "It's time for us to start launching them right here at home."

title: U.S. sanctions Chinese satellite firm for allegedly supplying SAR imagery to Russia’s Wagner Group
summary: The U.S. has sanctioned a Chinese small satellite manufacturer for allegedly supplying Russia's Wagner Group with radar satellite imagery of Ukraine to support its combat operations

title: Supporting military operations on Earth to remain U.S. Space Force’s top priority
summary: Top acquisition executive Frank Calvelli said the Space Force must focus on advancing satellites systems for military operations on Earth

title: SpaceX’s backup Dragon launch pad on track for 2023 debut
summary: SpaceX has begun building a backup launch pad for its Cargo and Crew Dragon spacecraft and says the facility could be ready...
